definition[0]: a business capitalized with a particular amount of money has that amount available in loans and money that has been invested in its shares
example[0]: It is very well-capitalized and in a strong financial position.
example[1]: They will create a new fund to keep poorly capitalized banks from failing.
definition[1]: if a cost is capitalized, it is shown in a companyâ€™s BALANCE SHEET as a charge that is reduced over several years, rather than being shown in the PROFIT AND LOSS ACCOUNT as a charge for a particular year
example[2]: Software development costs will not be capitalised on the balance sheet.
